definitions.definition: Removal of dirt.
The first part of the event clean and jerk in which the weight is brought from the ground to the shoulders.
To remove dirt from a place or object.
definitions.example: Can you clean the windows today?

definitions.definition: To tidy up, make a place neat.
To remove equipment from a climbing route after it was previously lead climbed.
To make things clean in general.
definitions.example: She just likes to clean. That’s why I married her.

definitions.definition: To remove unnecessary files, etc. from (a directory, etc.).
To brush the ice lightly in front of a moving rock to remove any debris and ensure a correct line; less vigorous than a sweep.
To purge a raw of any blemishes caused by the scanning process such as brown tinting and poor color contrast.
To remove guts and/or scales of a butchered animal.
(heading, physical) Free of dirt or impurities or protruberances.
(heading, behavioural) Free of immorality or criminality.
Smooth, exact, and performed well
definitions.example: I’ll need a sharper knife to make clean cuts.  a clean leap over a fence

definitions.definition: Total; utter. (still in "clean sweep")
Cool or neat.
definitions.example: Wow, Dude, those are some clean shoes ya got there!

definitions.definition: (health) Being free of sexually transmitted diseases (STDs).
definitions.example: I want to make sure my fiancé is clean before we are married.

definitions.definition: That does not damage the environment.
Free from that which is useless or injurious; without defects.
Free from restraint or neglect; complete; entire.
Well-proportioned; shapely.
(of a route) Ascended without falling.
Fully and completely.
